result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian E Kropelin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:02 p.m. Defendant present in person and in custody with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat recites plea agreement - Defendant will plead to count 1 and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  DA concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.  

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST to count 1.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  Sentence Withheld and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:
-Pay Court costs.
-Defendant is to follow all recommendations os the supervising agent.
-Defendant is to complete a High school education or equivalency.

Court grants the defendant 74 days of sentence credit if probation becomes revoked.

Court adjourned at 2:12 p.m.
State's
Status hearing on November 11, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Defendant's Discovery Demand
for Discovery (Defendant's)

1:32 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present, in custody, with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat indicates the defendant will be waiving his right to a preliminary - defendant concurs.  Court instructs defendant of his right to a preliminary hearing - defendant waives this right - court accepts the waiver and binds the defendant over for trial.

DA files an Information with the court and provides a copy to Attorney Privat.  Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the Information - waives reading - enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court makes statement regarding the maximum penalties.  

Court directs case be set for Status Hearing.

Court adjourned at 1:34 p.m.
Preliminary hearing on October 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
to Modify Bail (Defendant's) - ORIGINAL

10:57 a.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.    Defendant present in custody with Attorney Barb Privat.

Statement by Attorney Privat - requests an adjournment of the case and requests to be heard only as to the bond modification - argument by Attorney Privat.  Court questions the defendant.  Argument by DA.  Court denies motion to modify bond.

Court directs Preliminary Hearing to be held in approximately thirty days - Attorney Privat to advise if the hearing will be a waiver or not.

Court adjourned at 11:01 a.m.
By Atty Barbara Privat
to Modify Bail (Defendant's) - FAX COPY
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

2:54 p.m.  State by DA Andrew Christenson.  Defendant present via video from Green Lake County Jail with Attorney Barb Privat.

Attorney Privat confirms receipt of the complaint - waives reading.  Court instructs regarding the maximum penalties.  Court finds probable cause.

Court orders bond set at $250.00 cash with the conditions of:    Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Attorney Privat waives time limits on the preliminary hearing - will be representing the defendant.

Court directs matter be set for status hearing regarding the preliminary hearing.

Court adjourned at 2:58 p.m.
